alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Franklin, southeastern Jefferson and Douglas Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McLouth to 5 miles east of Ottawa. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Eudora, Wellsville, Centropolis, Perry, Lecompton, Clinton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Vinland, Williamstown, Clinton Lake and Globe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 186 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 190 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
